This is generally considered the best of Cantinflas&#039; films. Its last scene is based on the true events involving Mexican criminal ÃƒÆ’?lvaro Chapa and his public declarations that inspired Cantinflas&#039; form of speech for this film. The film was directed by Juan Bustillo Oro and it is based largely on Bustillo&#039;s experience as a pro bono lawyer at the BelÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©n Jail. The film was completed in only three weeks and the only problems during filming were caused by Cantinflas&#039; improvisation, because of what he considered to be a poor-written script.
